title: Certificate Issue
content:
Hello, I just re installed Windows 10 and the current version of Thunderbird Mail 115.2.2 64 bit.

My issue is setting up my Proto Mail using the Proton Mail Bridge Program (Which worked for me before the re install). I am having an issue with the Certificate. I have reached out to Proton Mail also but have not had a response yet. I use all the server settings Proton asks us to use but Thunderbird does not see the Certificate as valid.

I can not send mail properly and after initial setup Thunderbird stops updating new mail from Proton

Any help would be appreciated

Regards, Ken
creator: kenriley1961

title: Thunderbird is only showing "some" events within my Google calendar
content:
I used to use the Gmail Provider addon for my Google Calendar, but it had been acting funny for months when it came to syncing. So I switched to native support and everything was working great mostly.

But then the last few days or so, the Calendar stopped showing some of the events. Some of them show just fine but a lot of my events are missing. They are still there on the Gmail side of things. They just don't show in Thunderbird.

I found a recent chat about this exact thing but it was an outdated issue that I believe was fixed. But here it is again (or maybe a different cause/bug is behind it this time).

I don't know if its the difference between events that show you as busy or free, or if something else is the variable the determines what shows and what isn't. But it is definitely not working right now. I had to sync my Google calendar with with Windows Calendar for the time being.
creator: jh20001

title: Limit subfolders shown - templates, sent
content:
I have 5 e-mail accounts, and move read e-mails to a related folder under Local Folders.

In TB 102, using the Unified view, there are grouped folders at the top for sent, templates, archive, draft, etc. Under each individual account, these were not duplicated. To get to Account A's Templates folder, I'd go to the unified Templates folder, expand it, and click on Account A Templates.

Now, under 115, these folders are shown _both_ under the Unified folder _and_ under each account. This not only takes up precious space, but is confusing. How can I get unified-eligible folders to show up _only_ under the Unified folder view?

Note that it seems to be only Sent and Template folders that are duplicated. I'm _not_ seeing duplicates of Archived, Junk, or Drafts.

I feel like I dealt with this in an earlier iteration of TB, but I'm damned if I can recall how, and can't find an answer through search.
creator: bma.query

title: Printing a single Email not the whole "chain" -  How can I do this?
content: Hi, I am using the latest Thunderbird 115.2.2 on a Win10 system and would like to print only the latest email from a long "chain" of emails. When I select the email I want to print it picks up all the "headers" from the old emails in the trail and wants to print all these as well. I have attached an example that only shows a small email, but I have some that have 15-20 emails in the trail. I know I can restrict how many pages to print but that seems like a cumbersome way to do it and still gives you "some partial info" from the other emails. I'm not sure what I'm missing and have been a long term Thunderbird user for many years. In the example attached, I only want to print the latest email at the top and not the following info that could in most cases be over about 7-8 pages. I hope my explanation is clear to you. Can you help, please? Many thanks, David
creator: dph2107

title: Added calendar events not showing in Thunderbird calendar
content:
I have a hosted email service that I access via Thunderbird.

Currently, new events that I create do not show in my calendar.

I create an event:"New event">enter details etc>"save and close" and there's nothing there. I've synced the calendar. FYI, when I create an event via the web interface of my client, it appears in the calendar.

I'm using v115.2.2

Any advice?
